meanings.definition: Having magnetic properties similar to ferrite
meanings.sent1: The ferrimagnetic material attracted the iron filings easily.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ferrimagnetic properties of the new compound.
meanings.sent3: The ferrimagnetic fridge magnet had a strong pull on the paper clip.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like a ferrimagnetic force, drawing people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The ferrimagnetic effect was so strong that even the smallest metal object was affected.

meanings.sent1: The ferrimagnetic was used in the construction of the new device.
meanings.sent2: The researchers analyzed the ferrimagnetic under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The ferrimagnetic on the fridge kept falling off due to its strong pull.
meanings.sent4: His words had a ferrimagnetic effect on the audience, capturing their attention.
meanings.sent5: The ferrimagnetic displayed unique properties that made it stand out from other materials.

meanings.sent1: The ferrimagnetic of the material was crucial for its application in technology.
meanings.sent2: The team investigated the ferrimagnetic of the substance to understand its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The ferrimagnetic of the toy caused it to stick to the metal surface.
meanings.sent4: In a metaphorical sense, her charm had a ferrimagnetic quality that drew people in.
meanings.sent5: The ferrimagnetic of the rock was so strong that it affected nearby compass needles.
